textos_fuente.text:
Orlando Sales and Events Manager | Party Venue | Events Venue | Nightlife | Live Music | Howl at the Moon Locations Boston Chicago Fort Lauderdale Foxborough Indianapolis Kansas City Louisville Orlando Pittsburgh San Antonio Howl at Sea The Show The Drinks Book A Party Blog Howl2GO Upcoming Events 2000S PARTY TAYLOR TAKEOVER PINK PARTY CONNECT WITH US Howl at the Moon Locations Boston Chicago Fort Lauderdale Foxborough Indianapolis Kansas City Louisville Orlando Pittsburgh San Antonio Howl at Sea The Show The Drinks Book A Party Blog Howl2GO Upcoming Events 2000S PARTY TAYLOR TAKEOVER PINK PARTY Orlando Sales and Events Manager Book Your Event PARTIES & EVENTS Corporate Events Holiday Parties Birthday Parties Table Reservations Bachelorette Parties Bachelor Parties PARTIES & EVENTS Corporate Events Holiday Parties Birthday Parties Table Reservations Bachelorette Parties Bachelor Parties “Just work hard and be nice to people.” -Michael Franti “Work Hard & Be Nice” Christin Bartlett Cimini, Orlando Sales and Events Manager Email: orlandosales@howlatthemoon.com Hometown: Royal Palm Beach, FL First employed at Howl at the Moon Orlando in 2006 Q. What do you love most about working at Howl at the Moon? A. I love live music and I enjoy being able to listen to our band every event I host. Q. What does life outside of Howl at the Moon look like? A. I love concerts, traveling and morning snuggles with my dogs. Q. Share a Fun Fact about yourself! A. From a young age, I knew I wanted to work in the hospitality industry. My first love was working in country clubs. Working at the Breaker’s in Palm Beach was when I really understood my calling. I attended and graduated from University of Central Florida with a Business Degree specializing in Hospitality Management. While in college, I went to Howl at the Moon every weekend when it was located downtown. It was always our first stop and last stop of the night. When a position opened up after college once Howl at the Moon relocated to International Drive, I knew that I had to take it. I have been at Howl ever since and truly love the close family that it has become. What is your go-to song request at Howl at the Moon? A. I have many songs that are “my favorite” to request while I am at Howl at the Moon. “Jack & Diane”, “Son of a Preacher Man”, “Meet Virginia” and “The Weight” have to be the ones that come to me first. I always like to throw in some old school rap though, just to see it played on the piano. It really brightens my spirits. Q. What is your favorite animal? A. My favorite animal is definitely a dog. I have 4 rescued dogs now and I realized that is my limit. Thank goodness I have a huge backyard for them to play in. Paying for them to go to the Canine Country Club while on vacation is when I realized that 4 was my max. I am told that I am not allowed to visit shelters at this point in my life. Q. What was your favorite vacation? A. My favorite vacation has to include a tropical location. It is funny when people from up north ask where does someone from Florida go for vacation and I answer “anywhere tropical”, I do get strange looks. I love Hawaii, the Caribbean, the French Riviera, Spain and Italy as my favorites! Even when we traveled to Europe, we made sure that we included the Mediterranean, so that I could enjoy the coastline. It did help that we were on a cruise ship for two of our European vacations. Q. Who is your favorite band? A. I love going to music celebrations. We have gone on the Rock Boat Cruise, Sail Across the Sun Cruise and Zac Brown Celebration in Mexico to name a few. It is so nice to enjoy a tropical vacation with your favorite music bands! My favorite bands from these have been Barenaked Ladies, Sister Hazel, Train, Zac Brown and Michael Franti & Spearhead. Q. What is your favorite hobby? A. My favorite hobby is scuba diving! I love the feeling of being so far down in the ocean and seeing creatures and fish that I have never seen before. My best scuba diving experiences has been in Oahu and Kona, both in Hawaii. With over 60 dives, I still haven’t seen any sharks yet, but I have seen many eels, octopus, sea turtles, dolphins, lobster and plenty of fish. Sharks are on my list to see, but at a distance! Orlando Live Music Bar Howl at the Moon can host birthday parties , bachelor parties , bachelorette parties , holiday parties , corporate events . Book your party today. We can also host private parties , meetings , cocktail parties , networking events , fundraisers , team building events , award ceremonies , graduation parties and more. Fort Lauderdale FAQ Page Locations Boston Chicago Fort Lauderdale Foxborough Indianapolis Kansas City Louisville Orlando Pittsburgh San Antonio Howl at Sea The Show The Drinks Book A Party Blog Howl2GO Upcoming Events 2000S PARTY TAYLOR TAKEOVER PINK PARTY CONNECT WITH US Howl at the Moon Locations Boston Chicago Fort Lauderdale Foxborough Indianapolis Kansas City Louisville Orlando Pittsburgh San Antonio Howl at Sea The Show The Drinks Book A Party Blog Howl2GO Upcoming Events 2000S PARTY TAYLOR TAKEOVER PINK PARTY Club Info MENU Back To Fort Lauderdale Bachelorette Parties Birthday Parties Book Online Club Info Corporate Events Drink Menu Food Menu Holiday Parties Reserve A Table Back To Fort Lauderdale Bachelorette Parties Birthday Parties Book Online Club Info Corporate Events Drink Menu Food Menu Holiday Parties Reserve A Table General Manager Corydon Himelberger Email Me Sales and Events Manager Thayer Van Buren Email Me EMPLOYMENT We are always looking for top talent at Howl at the Moon. If you are energetic, customer focused, and hard working- we want to hear from you! View Available Positions FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS When will Howl at the Moon Fort Lauderdale be open? We are now open in Las Olas! What are the hours? Sunday: 6PM-12AM Monday: Open For Events Tuesday: Open For Events Wednesday: 6PM-1AM Thursday: 6PM-1AM Friday: 5PM-2AM Saturday: 5PM-2AM What is the address? 270 SE 6th Avenue Fort Lauderdale, FL 33301. What is Howl at the Moon Fort Lauderdale's contact information? Phone number: 754.356.4695 Email address: ftlauderdale@howlatthemoon.com . Do you have an age restriction for entry? We are 21-and-over every hour, every day, no exceptions. All guests must have a valid ID for entry. What time does the show start? Do I have to reserve a table? Sunday: 7 PM Wednesday: 7 PM Thursday: 7 PM Friday: 6 PM Saturday: 6 PM You can come and go as you please during the show and you do not need reservations to come to Howl at the Moon, however, tables do go quickly on the weekends so we suggest making a reservation if you would like one. Is Howl at the Moon Fort Lauderdale on social media? Yes. Check us out on Facebook , Instagram and Twitter . Which kind of parties and events can Howl at the Moon Fort Lauderdale host? Howl at the Moon Fort Lauderdale can host birthday parties , bachelor parties , bachelorette parties , holiday parties , corporate events . Book your party today. We can also host private parties , meetings , cocktail parties , networking events , fundraisers , team building activities , award ceremonies , graduation parties and more. Is there parking available? Howl at the Moon Fort Lauderdale is a proud partner of SpotHero, a mobile app that helps you find affordable parking near our venue! Reserve your spot ahead of time and use their provided QR code to enter and exit the lot. Visit this link to ensure you have a space to park when you arrive. Can we get to Howl at the Moon Fort Lauderdale by water? Yes. Howl at the Moon Fort Lauderdale is Water Taxi, Stop #1. Fort Lauderdale Press Release | Bars | Nightlife | Clubs | Bars | Party Venues | Event Space | Piano Bar | Howl at the Moon Locations Boston Chicago Fort Lauderdale Foxborough Indianapolis Kansas City Louisville Orlando Pittsburgh San Antonio Howl at Sea The Show The Drinks Book A Party Blog Howl2GO Upcoming Events 2000S PARTY TAYLOR TAKEOVER PINK PARTY CONNECT WITH US Howl at the Moon Locations Boston Chicago Fort Lauderdale Foxborough Indianapolis Kansas City Louisville Orlando Pittsburgh San Antonio Howl at Sea The Show The Drinks Book A Party Blog Howl2GO Upcoming Events 2000S PARTY TAYLOR TAKEOVER PINK PARTY Fort Lauderdale Press Release Grand Opening Information HOWL AT THE MOON IS BRINGING NONSTOP LIVE MUSIC TO FORT LAUDERDALE OCTOBER 2024 The live music bar is ready to bring endless entertainment to the Las Olas neighborhood, beginning with a Grand Opening Party to be announced soon. Las Olas is about to howl louder than ever! Howl at the Moon is proud to announce the grand opening of our brand-new Fort Lauderdale venue, located at 270 SE 6th Avenue. We are kicking things off with a Grand Opening celebration to be announced soon. This party will feature drink specials on our mixed drinks, beers, 86oz. buckets and of course, our unbeatable live music show all night long. Howl at the Moon’s 5,000-square-foot venue is about to rock Fort Lauderdale harder than ever! ABOUT HOWL AT THE MOON Howl at the Moon is a live music destination for travelers and locals alike, bringing a unique nightlife experience of singing and dancing! Howl at the Moon has been a leading nightlife destination for over 30 years. With 13 locations nationwide and residencies aboard 3 cruise line ships, Howl at the Moon is always in pursuit of the perfect show and creating an unforgettable night out. With a set list created by today’s hits, party classics and song requests from the audience, Howl at the Moon helps people sing louder, dance happier and so much more. Their versatile and talented musicians rotate instruments and take turns singing throughout the night creating a non-stop, high-energy show! Howl at the Moon is located in most major cities in America involving musicians who travel worldwide. Our in-house musicians take the stage from the moment our doors open until last call. There are no breaks and no intermissions; therefore guests are welcome to come and go as they please. Our musicians rotate instruments and take turns singing throughout the night which allows music to continue nonstop. Howl at the Moon features specialty cocktails, customizable party space, a lively engaging staff and the promise of an experience unlike any other. Contact Information Website: https://www.howlatthemoon.com/fort-lauderdale/ Phone number: 754-356-4695 Email address: ftlauderdale@howlatthemoon.com Address: 270 SE 6th Avenue Fort Lauderdale, FL 33301 Learn More https://www.howlatthemoon.com/fort-lauderdale/ https://www.instagram.com/howlatthemoon https://www.instagram.com/howlftl https://www.tiktok.com/@_howlatthemoon? https://www.facebook.com/howlftl https://x.com/_howlatthemoon Join Our Mailing List You Could Win A Party Sign Up First Name * Last Name * Email * Location * - Choose a Location - Boston Chicago Fort Lauderdale Indianapolis Kansas City Louisville Orlando Pittsburgh San Antonio Birth Month * - Birth Month - January February March April May June July August September October November December Sign up to win a party? Howl at the Moon Returns to Fort Lauderdale | Lifestyle Media Group SOUTH FLORIDA BUSINESS & WEALTH MAGAZINE Digital Magazine Skip to content Main Navigation Lifestyle Media Group Search for: Sections Arts & Culture Ask the Experts Community and Philanthropy Editor’s Choice Cover Stories Editor’s Choice Local Business Good Press Industries Industries Community & Philanthropy Fashion and Retail Fashion and Retail Health Care & Wellness Hospitality Real Estate Retail Travel & Recreation Food & Drink Featured Restaurants Food & Drink Nightlife People Profiles A&E Spotlight People Profiles Local Buzz Around Town Local Buzz Things To Do Web Extras About Lifestyle Media Advertise With Us Contact Us Digital Publications Meet The Team Subscribe Social Media Connect Our Other Brands South Florida's largest single-title brand Subscribe Header Navigation Editor’s Choice Cover Stories Industries Travel & Recreation Real Estate Community and Philanthropy Arts & Culture Fashion and Retail Health Care & Wellness Good Press Food & Drink Featured Restaurants People Profiles A&E Spotlight Events Local Buzz Things To Do Ask the Experts About Us Contact Us Meet The Team Advertise With Us Local Buzz Howl at the Moon Returns to Fort Lauderdale The music venue’s disappearance was just an interlude. October 14, 2024 | Jesse Scott Remembering those infectious crowd sing-alongs and radiating piano riffs stemming from Beach Place circa the mid-2000s? Well, the source of those seemingly endless good times on Fort Lauderdale Beach was Howl at the Moon, and by the end of October, it’s back with a new local address and vibe. Howl at the Moon will open at 270 Southeast 6th Avenue in downtown Fort Lauderdale, a block north of the super-central Cheesecake Factory on Las Olas Boulevard. It will occupy a 5,000-square-foot, multifaceted entertainment space, able to host 250 to 300 guests at a time. “The truth is that ever since we left Fort Lauderdale, we’ve been looking to come back,” says Jessica Tarsnane, national marketing manager for Howl at the Moon. “There wasn’t ever really a reason we wanted to leave aside from our lease not working out then. Now we’re back and we’ve really elevated the experience.” For Howl at the Moon newbies, the first location opened in Cincinnati in 1990, with a dueling piano bar set-up, where the musicians took on-the-spot crowd requests for songs to be played. The concept grew throughout Ohio and its first out-of-state outpost opened in Orlando in 1993. Today, the brand operates 13 locations nationwide and has entertainment residencies on three cruise ship lines. The biggest difference between yesteryear and the Howl at the Moon of today is the music set-up, Tarsnane says. “We’ve gone from two entertainers and two pianos to a full band with different instruments, performing together and rotating instruments. It really is a multifaceted and multi-talented group.” Long-time fans don’t fret – there are still two baby grand pianos front and center on the Howl at the Moon stage, but you may hear some bass, guitar, keytar, banjo, saxophone or flute woven in on a given night. The Fort Lauderdale location will feature a rotation of eight to 10 musicians, the bulk of which were recently flown up to Chicago to audition for a coveted spot. Beyond a central stage for the performers, the Fort Lauderdale venue will feature high-top tables for prime viewing and seating for four. There will be two bars — the larger of the bars will have roll-up, garage-like doors that segue to a sweeping patio making for quite the indoor-outdoor ambiance. As for what to enjoy at those bars, Tarsnane says that Howl at the Moon’s novelty bucket drinks – coming in 86-ounce and 32-ounce sizes – are a national favorite. Concoctions span the traditional (e.g. a rum-loaded hurricane) to the “Hot Girl Summer,” which is a mixture of Three Olives citrus vodka, Malibu rum, lime juice, simple syrup and two types of Red Bull. Unique to the Fort Lauderdale location will be décor touches paying homage to “the Venice of America” as well as its hours. Whereas most Howl at the Moon locations are open solely Thursday through Saturday, this one will be open seven days a week. Count on a cover fee in the $5 to $10 range, but there will be ways to get free admission, Tarsnane says, by either making a table reservation or booking a happy hour party. Beyond its opening phase, Howl at the Moon hopes to be a haven for special occasions aplenty, spanning bachelor and bachelorette parties, birthday events and corporate functions. The brand is working on implementing some of its most popular music-themed nights twice a month, including the likes of ’90s night, country night and emo night. “The way we’ve stayed top-of-mind through the years has been by bringing a truly unique show to our customers,” says Tarsnane. “You could go to any other live performance out there and see the same singer sticking to the same instrument and songs night after night. The versatility of our entertainers and how they interact with an audience is like no other. With our shows and the songs our audiences request, you will never experience the same night twice.” Print Share Share on Facebook Share on Twitter Share on LinkedIn Share on Pinterest Tags: featured You May Also Like Guy Harvey Foundation August 27, 2025 The Real: Harbor Beach July 2, 2025 PAMM Hosts “One Year Out” Celebration for FIFA World Cup 2026 June 7, 2025 Oscar Piastri Wins the Formula 1 Trophy, Presented in Louis Vuitton Custom Trunk May 6, 2025 featured Sixteen Years of Style, Strength & Support Sep 9, 2025 Next Stop, Flavor town Sep 4, 2025 The Rise of the Cool-cation Sep 4, 2025 Keep up with Lifestyle's top headlines Subscribe to our free eNewsletter Email Address (Required) Phone This field is for validation purposes and should be left unchanged. The versatility of our entertainers and how they interact with an audience is like no other. With our shows and the songs our audiences request, you will never experience the same night twice.” To learn more, visit www.howlatthemoon.com/fort-lauderdale/ .
